file.openFile.body:
with open('${1:pyfile.txt}', ${2:'r'}) as f:
	print(f.read())$0
# end open file

file.openFileReadLine.body:
with open('${1:pyfile.txt}', ${2:'r'}) as f:
	for line in f:
		# process each line here, remove \n using strip
		line = line.replace("    ", "\t").strip()
		print(line, end=",\n")$0
	# end for
# end readline file
file.openFileReadLine.description: Read one line of the file

file.openFileReadSingleLine.body:
with open('${1:pyfile.txt}', ${2:'r'}) as f:
	print(f.readline())$0
# end readline file
file.openFileReadSingleLine.description: Read one line of the file

file.appendFile.body:
with open('${1:pyfile.txt}', ${2:'a'}) as f:
	f.write(${2:"text here"})$0
# end append file

file.overwriteFile.body:
with open('${1:pyfile.txt}', ${2:'w'}) as f:
	f.write(${2:"new text"})$0
# end overwrite file
file.overwriteFile.description: Open a file and overwrite the content
